comment: Finally got a chance to try triticale and was not disappointed. An interesting hybrid of light citrus and spice.
Wasn't impressed for all the hype. Started out with sweet wheat and then rye completely took over. Cool to try once or twice but nothing special
Good call by Ms. Schuster on the wheat toast with cinnamon. Nose is medium, definite cereal nose with rye spice builds and overtakes wheat in the finish, which is fairly long.
Semisweet nose, smooth body, wheat aftertaste.
Weirdly super light mouthfeel. Feels like water. Slightly sweet and grainy, like honey bread
Got to know the guys a little bit who opened this place and they are great.  Miss them and living in the northwest.
Not bad for the price point. Kind of reminiscent of crown royal northern harvest
Great blend of wheat and rye characteristics, combined with the price make it a fantastic value bottle!

A very approachable pour to someone new to Bourbon or who likes a tamer dram. It is very light, soft and sweet due to the wheat character and hints of Rye notes all wrapped in a unique hybrid grain. The aromas and flavors meld together nicely. It is a good whiskey but won’t be repeated as it’s a Washington exclusive.
sweet and spicy. Note, actually tasting a TotalWine exclusive 5 year old cask strength bottling, Barrel 138.
